intro: Lappula gracilenta, commonly known as slender lappula, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by papery, ribbed seed pods. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. Lappula gracilenta is adapted to disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
